intro: Lespedeza virgata, commonly known as silverleaf lespedeza, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant produces small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it its common name. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in open woodlands and disturbed areas. Lespedeza virgata is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators.
